text.0: .@PaulSaxMD summarizes great ID questions from a recent online course he co-teaches at Harvard Medical School. https://t.co/UKh2BHuZ7K
text.1: Patients who had discontinued statins because of side effects received four bottles of a statin, four bottles of placebo, and four empty bottles, each to be used for 1 month at random for 12 months. The symptom burden with placebo was 90% of the symptom burden with the statin.
text.2: The effects of rivaroxaban in patients with atrial fibrillation and a bioprosthetic mitral valve remain uncertain. This visual abstract shows the results of a multicenter, open-label, randomized, noninferiority trial.
text.3: All NEJM articles on the Race and Medicine topic page are freely available.
text.4: A 35-year-old man was admitted with lymphadenopathy and thrombocytopenia. Four months earlier, painless lymphadenopathy had developed in the groin area; a biopsy showed necrosis, fibrosis, and inflammation but no malignant cells. A diagnostic procedure was performed.
